alert.note: Alert for Western Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 07 at 1:15PM PST until March 08 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected above 1500 feet, mainly west of the Scott Valley. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches except for higher amounts of 12 to 15 inches above 4000 feet. For the Winter Weather Advisory, 1 to 4 inches of snow expected. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, areas above 1500 feet elevation in western Siskiyou County west of the Scott Valley, including Sawyers Bar Road. For the Winter Weather Advisory, areas below 1500 feet elevation and the Scott Valley. This includes Somes Bar, Happy Camp, Seiad Valley, Etna and Scott Bar. * WHEN...From 4 AM Tuesday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is imminent and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
